turns.content:
Hi Emeka,

Thank you for connecting with me. After reviewing your profile, I wanted to clarify that at Televero Health, we are specifically looking to hire psychiatrists and Licensed Clinical Social Workers (LCSWs). Based on your background, it appears that you have extensive experience in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology sectors. While we appreciate your impressive experience, we are currently focusing on candidates with clinical backgrounds.

Please let me know if you have any relevant qualifications or experience as a psychiatrist or LCSW that I might have missed. Otherwise, I wish you all the best in your career, and thank you again for connecting.

Best regards,
Bailey Baker

please rewrite that message and encourage a referral

Hi Amy,

Thank you for your response and clarification. I apologize for the confusion. At Televero Health, we are currently focusing on hiring psychiatrists and Licensed Clinical Social Workers (LCSWs). While we value your experience as an LPC Associate, our current openings are specifically for psychiatrists and LCSWs.

If you happen to know any psychiatrists or LCSWs in your professional network who may be interested in exploring opportunities at Televero Health, we would greatly appreciate any referrals. Your recommendation could make a significant impact on their career and help us continue providing quality mental health services to our clients.

We appreciate your interest and will keep your information on file for future opportunities that may align with your qualifications. Thank you again for connecting, and I wish you continued success in your career.

Best regards,
Bailey Baker

An LPC Associate (Licensed Professional Counselor Associate) is a pre-licensed mental health professional who has completed their educational requirements and is working under the supervision of a fully licensed professional counselor. This is typically a transitional stage for individuals pursuing a career in mental health counseling.

During this stage, LPC Associates are required to accrue a specific number of supervised clinical hours before they can apply for full licensure as an LPC (Licensed Professional Counselor). The requirements for becoming an LPC vary by state, but generally include completing a master's degree in counseling or a related field, passing a licensing exam, and completing a certain number of supervised clinical hours. Once fully licensed, LPCs can provide mental health counseling and psychotherapy services independently.

please rewrite this message and request clarification if he qualifies as a psychiatrist or LCSW

Hi Dr. Grove,

Thank you for taking the time to review my message. I wanted to follow up and request some clarification on your qualifications. At Televero Health, we are specifically looking for psychiatrists and Licensed Clinical Social Workers (LCSWs) to join our team.

Could you please confirm if you hold either of these qualifications? If so, I would be more than happy to discuss the counseling and psychiatric opportunities available at Televero Health. You can schedule a time that works best for you using my Calendly link: <https://calendly.com/bailey-baker-1/30min>

If you do not hold these qualifications but know of any colleagues who do and might be interested in such opportunities, I would greatly appreciate any referrals.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Bailey
